item.title: RT by @annaghunter: Very weird to me that #MeToo, both now and at its height, has been perceived as a movement about women’s confession and feelings—rather than attempt to organize against the material problem of men’s violence.

item.description: Very weird to me that #MeToo, both now and at its height, has been perceived as a movement about women’s confession and feelings—rather than attempt to organize against the material problem of men’s violence.

item.title: RT by @annaghunter: The more I read these panicked articles about places like NYC and San Francisco being 'unsafe', the more I realize it's not about crime at all - just discomfort with poverty being more visible

item.title: RT by @annaghunter: 1/ For many (not all) white women, particularly in the South, “Pro-Life” is an identity, not a consistent policy position. That identity was constructed in opposition to feminists, who they believed (and were told) looked down on their traditional gender roles.
item.dc:creator: @AngieMaxwell1
item.description: 1/ For many (not all) white women, particularly in the South, “Pro-Life” is an identity, not a consistent policy position. That identity was constructed in opposition to feminists, who they believed (and were told) looked down on their traditional gender roles.

item.title: R to @wtflanksteak: I loathe that phrase in a profile - instant swipe left. I’ve been at my thinnest when I was not taking care of myself.
